answers.answer: Its a RELIEF that you dont have preeclampsia. Thats great news, as for the PIH maybe you should work less? Have you tried drinking grapefruit juice? I heard it naturally reduces blood pressure.... *not sure if its true. BUT I have naturally low blood pressure and anytime i drink it, I get a headache, meaning my bp probably goes down even more..... Either way its worth a shot. Its not "meds" and its chock full of vitamin C!

http://www.healthguidance.org/entry/2393/1/How-To-Use-Grapefruit-to-Lower-High-Blood-Pressure. htmlTake space out between .htmlThis gives you a general idea of what grapefruit does. I dont think one grapefruit a day would have any effect on anyone. UNLESS your already on some type of meds, or your allergic to citrus. Its WORTH it to research your options bc having REALLY HBP and they will deliver you!  Just FYI! =o) Research some more....

yes im very relieved! i havent tried working less yet, im thinking that will be my next step. im a huge grapefruit fan and do drink it atleast 5 times a week or more. its the only thing that quenches my thirst! except dr.pepper.... which ive laid off of lol
Same with me hun I've got hypertension too, n midwife said today about me leaving work sooner, what's your bp at if u don't mind me askin
this morniing it was 138/88, earlier it was still 130's over 90

Do you check your BP at home? Perhaps you get "white coat syndrome" or whatever they call it. It is when just being at the hospital or near a doctor makes you nervous and raises your BP. Anyway monitoring your BP while at home or away from the doctor may be beneficial to rule that out.

I don't really kno how to control mine I've got no stress or anything mines peaked at 160/96  today was better tho, do you really think staying at work could make it worse? I've got 6 weeks till I choose to leave

Beccabb-its possible that work increases it. your doing stuff its kinda stressful im on my feet all day etc. those things contribute. i wouls recommend you take off soonerJoyRenee- i work at a clinic so im not one much to be afraid of doctors etc. i take it at work and at home and then they take it when i come in for appointments. but yes you're very right their are people i see veryday who absouletly HATE doctors offices and such and freak out completly

I have high blood pressure during every one of my pregnancies.  I'm only 12weeks and I've already been put on HBP meds.  All I can say is try to take it easy.  I'm sure they'll be keeping a close eye on you.  How far along are you?
they have me coming in weekly so yes. im 29w3d

question: went to the doc and was told my kidney/liver function test was great. My blood pressure is still high though. they told me to take it easy but a little hard working a full time job lol i keep trying tojust stay off my feet as much as possible. she might but me n bed rest if not improving. any advice? why is my blood pressure high??? ugh
title: not preeclampsia but still high blood pressure
